articles.author: MARCIA DUNN
articles.description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla. (AP) — NASA is wrestling over how and when to bring two astronauts back from the International Space Station, after repeatedly delaying their return aboard Boeing's troubled capsule.
articles.title: Could 2 NASA astronauts be stuck at the space station until next year? Here's what to know

articles.author: JILL COLVIN, MICHELLE L. PRICE and ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON
articles.description: PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — Donald Trump recommitted to debating Vice President Kamala Harris after recently backing out, holding a lengthy news conference Thursday in which he taunted his new rival, boasted of his crowd on Jan.
articles.title: Trump recommits to a Sept. 10 debate and lashes out at Harris at news conference

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: In his first news conference since Vice President Kamala Harris became the Democratic nominee for president, former President Donald Trump said he would debate her on Sept.
articles.title: FACT FOCUS: A look at claims made by Trump at news conference

articles.author: DARLENE SUPERVILLE, JOEY CAPPELLETTI and SEUNG MIN KIM
articles.description: WAYNE, Mich. (AP) — Vice President Kamala Harris and her running mate, Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz, played up their support for organized labor at a Detroit-area union hall on Thursday, with the Democratic nominee saying “we're all in this together” as the new ticket lavishes attention on a crucial base of support.
articles.title: Harris and Walz show their support for organized labor with appearance at Detroit union hall

articles.author: MAKIYA SEMINERA, JOHN MINCHILLO and ALLEN G. BREED
articles.description: LUCAMA, N.C. (AP) — Tornadoes spawned by Debby leveled homes, damaged a school and killed one person early Thursday, as the tropical system dropped heavy rain and flooded communities across North and South Carolina.
articles.title: A deadly tornado, flooding rains and swollen rivers plague residents in the path of Debby

articles.author: PHILIPP-MORITZ JENNE, STEFANIE DAZIO and KIRSTEN GRIESHABER
articles.description: VIENNA (AP) — Both suspects in a foiled plot to attack Taylor Swift shows in Vienna appeared to be inspired by the Islamic State group and al-Qaida, Austrian authorities said Thursday, and investigators found bomb-making materials at one of their homes.
articles.title: Suspects in foiled attack on Taylor Swift shows were inspired by Islamic State group, officials say

articles.author: TIM REYNOLDS
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — Down by 11 in the fourth quarter, against what looked like overwhelming odds, the U.S. Olympic men's basketball team got a spark.Six points in two seconds.Kevin Durant and Devin Booker provided that wild sequence to start the comeback, Stephen Curry had a scoring night like almost none other in U.S.
articles.title: US men's basketball team rallies to beat Serbia at Paris Olympics, will face France for gold medal

articles.author: MARCIA DUNN
articles.description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla. (AP) — NASA is wrestling over how and when to bring two astronauts back from the International Space Station, after repeatedly delaying their return aboard Boeing's troubled capsule.
articles.title: Could 2 NASA astronauts be stuck at the space station until next year? Here's what to know

articles.author: STAN CHOE
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — U.S. stocks rallied Thursday in Wall Street’s latest sharp swerve after a better-than-expected report on unemployment eased worries about the slowing economy.
articles.title: Wall Street rallies to its best day since 2022 on encouraging unemployment data; S&P 500 jumps 2.3%

articles.author: JOSHUA GOODMAN
articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — Federal investigators say they found the DNA of a decorated former U.S. Green Beret on some of the 60 automatic weapons he allegedly smuggled from Florida to South America as part of a failed 2020 coup attempt against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.
articles.title: DNA on weapons implicates ex-U.S. Green Beret in attempted Venezuelan coup, federal officials say
